roleset.name: move in circular fashion, onward rotational motion

alias.framenet: Moving_in_place Cause_motion Mass_motion Reshaping Motion Body_movement Sound_movement

roleset.note: ROLL-V NOTES: Frames file for 'roll' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet classes build-26.1 coil-9.6 preparing-26.3-1 roll-51.3.1 run-51.3.2-2 shake-22.3-2 slide-11.2-1 split-23.2, bend-45.2, crane-40.3.2, sound_emission-43.2, sound_existence-47.4. Comparison with verbs of motion. (from roll.01-v predicate notes)
ROLL-N NOTES: Added by Julia. Based on roll-v.01 and VNcls roll-51.3.1. Corresponds to Vncls roll-51.3.1. (from roll.01-n)

roles.note: Arg2-secondary attribute (PRD in effect) replaced by arg2-direction based on predicted frequency, VN. (from roll.01-n)

role.descr: secondary attribute of arg1, end state/location

example.name: ergative
example.text: [The sets]-1 started *trace*-1 to roll around once more.

example.name: all args
example.text: John rolled the cookie dough flat.

example.name: dir for direction of movement
example.text: There was a roll of laughter through the stands ,

example.name: args 0 and 1
example.text: A shooter began his roll of the dice Saturday, November 15, 2003 at approximately 11 p.m., and did not roll a "seven"

roleset.name: bring out, cause to appear, introduce

example.name: introduce
example.text: Cray Computer also will face intense competition, not only from Cray Research, which has about 60 % of the world-wide supercomputer market and which *trace-1*-2 is expected *trace-2* to roll out the C-90 machine, a direct competitor with the Cray-3, in 1991.
example.arg: the C-90 machine, a direct competitor with the Cray-3,

example.name: ergative
example.text: The last of the bombers rolled out in April 1988.

roleset.name: cause to be in a coil

role.descr: thing rolling up or being rolled up

example.name: all args
example.text: [Equitec Financial Group]-1 said it will ask as many as 100,000 investors in 12 of its public real-estate limited partnerships to give approval to *trace*-1 rolling them up into a new master limited partnership.
example.arg: into a new master limited partnership.

roleset.name: move backwards, rollingly
roleset.note: ROLLBACK-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on roll-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls roll-51.3.1. (from rollback.01-n)

roles.note: verb frame's arg2-PRD not necessary in this nominalization (from rollback.01-n)

example.name: arg1
example.text: California property owners have benefited from a tax rollback ...

example.name: both args
example.text: Cook County commissioners couldn't make their rollback of the county's controversial sales tax stick Tuesday
example.arg: of the county's controversial sales tax
